directions.step:
DFrom: lepineb@ere.umontreal.ca Date: Fri, 6 May 1994 02:52:49 GMT
For bannock, you only have to mix a cup full of flour with a little salt, half a tea spoon of baking powder and enough water to make all this become sticky. Roll it like a big sausage around a stick (put butter on the stick before) and bake on a fire camp untill the bread is golden. You have to do this in the woods, of course, with a blanket around the shoulders (it's still cold at 6 in the morning...). Have a nice time camping! Brigitte.
